basis: User expresses strong agreement with the plan, mentions concrete steps (pause, hydration, logging mood/triggers, veggie prep, box-breathing, short walk), and explicitly frames slips as data to learn from. Indicates tonightâ€™s enactment and ongoing tracking, which signals high likelihood of action.
cognitive_dissonance: Low. User aligns actions with stated goals (BED management, stress coping) and shows self-compassion. Some residual concern about stress after work, but plan explicitly addresses it.
negative_thought_patterns: Possible residual perfectionism about sticking to plan, but mitigated by viewing slips as data and embracing gradual progress.
emotional_triggers: Post-work stress and BED concerns; environment/social cues. These factors drive cravings but are being explicitly planned for with coping strategies and environmental prep.
coaching_notes: The user responds well to concrete, bite-sized actions and self-compassion. Maintain short, specific steps (pause, logging, veggie prep) and reinforce viewing slips as learning opportunities. Encourage ongoing tracking of mood, triggers, and early hunger cues; explore adding flexible non-food coping techniques and social/environmental cue strategies as needed.
